rename.from: Regression: MalformedParametersException on JDK-8 for synthetic bridge methods on Jupiter classes (version 5.11.0-M1 only)
rename.to: `MalformedParametersException` on JDK 8 for synthetic bridge methods in Jupiter classes (5.11.0-M1)

body:
Thanks for the detailed report! Based on your reproducer I created a test (see [`marc/3797-bridge-method-reproducer`](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/tree/marc/3797-bridge-method-reproducer) branch) and used it find the initial commit introducing the issue: 89303135ba1621ac2d184e24ccdf378c6055bb75. In that commit, the build was switched to use JDK 21 instead of 17 for compilation.

The 5.11.0-M1 binaries where created using
```
Created-By: 21.0.2 (Eclipse Adoptium 21.0.2+13-LTS)
```

I've verified locally that the problem persists with Temurin 21.0.3+9.
This is the underlying change, introduced in Java 21: https://bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8292275
Adding `-parameters` seems to fix the issue: https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/pull/3798

issue.title: Fix reflection issue on JDK 8 for synthetic bridge methods

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
By enabling `-parameters` their names are written to the compiled bytecode in addition to the synthetic flag thereby avoiding to trip up the `Method#getParameters` API when running on JDK 8.

Fixes #3797.

body: FYI: https://bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8058322 fixed the underlying issue some time ago.
